definition: to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
to curry favor by showing obeisance (idiom)
to curry favor/to get the desired outcome by flattery
to throw oneself at sb or sth/to bend over backwards to help

sentences.english: I was married at 19 in Spanish Town to a bride already courted for me.
sentences.chinese: 我19岁在西班牙城结了婚，娶了一个讨好我的妻子。

sentences.english: I used to be upset by these attempts to ingratiate .
sentences.chinese: 我以前常常对这样的“讨好”感到厌烦。

sentences.english: She tried to brownnose the boss by staying after work and helping him clean the room.
sentences.chinese: 她企图在下班后呆下来帮老板清扫房间以讨好他。

sentences.english: "This is often a very thankless job, " Legge says.
sentences.chinese: 莱格博士说“饭馆服务员是个费力不讨好的工作。

sentences.english: A fat gray cat rubs against her leg. It meows.
sentences.chinese: 一只肥大的灰猫讨好地抓她的腿，喵喵地叫唤着。

sentences.english: He charmed Olivia and Abby by making pancakes on Sunday mornings.
sentences.chinese: 他还在星期天早晨下厨做煎饼来讨好奥丽维娅和艾碧。

sentences.english: Is Russia cozying up to China?
And it's kind of fun. They're sucking up to you.
sentences.chinese: 这挺有趣儿的，他们讨好你。

sentences.english: Less of Mr Bush's Manichaean arrogance would be welcome.
sentences.chinese: 少一些布什先生那种摩尼教徒式的傲慢将更为讨好。

sentences.english: Some said yes just to flatter him.
The party also walks a fine line in its proposed policies toward business.
sentences.chinese: 日本民主党所提出的商业政策也是两面不讨好。

sentences.english: If you're a people pleaser, learn to say "no" to people this year.
sentences.chinese: 如果你总是讨好别人，今年请试着学会说“不”吧。

sentences.english: Tom was throwing himself at your sister at the party last night.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆在晚会上极力向你妹妹讨好。
这可是一个两头不能讨好的难题。

sentences.english: Susch parts are often considered to be thankless, unrewarding.
sentences.chinese: 这种角色通常被变为是吃力不讨好的。

sentences.english: Ep688 - Yingming fawns on Mingming's father as he plans to woo Mingming.
sentences.chinese: 英明百般讨好明明的父亲，希望他帮忙追求明明。

definition: to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
favor/liking/love/jubilation/joy
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
to try to please
to express goodwill/to be friendly
to bow and bend the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
to flatter
to be particularly attentive to (an attractive young lady or man etc)/to fawn upon (an influential politician etc)/to court sb's favor/to ingratiate oneself
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
to accept a compromise
servile
to worm one's way into being friends with sb (usually derogatory)
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
